poem:
Title: "Shadows of Yesterday"

Cathy, etching life on the foggy pane 
where memories linger—
Twisted like ancient tree roots.
A carousel of fears,
ceiling staring, nights woven in dread.
Mother's mad melodies, father's liquid anger
And innocence, held hostage in the crossfire.

Yes, names for this abound,
Yet none could quite echo 
the haunted ballet of your past,
Only silenced by growing light of tomorrow.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Untangling the effects of childhood trauma is essential to finding the correct diagnosis | Dr Ahona Guha Cathy was referred to me by her GP for treatment for borderline personality disorder (BPD). She had had a very difficult childhood. Her mother had bipolar disorder and was hospitalised on numerous occasions and her father had difficulties with alcohol abuse, often becoming angry and violent when intoxicated. The pervasive emotion Cathy remembers experiencing was fear. She was". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
